I have a strong track record of helping organisations by identifying the right problems to solve by staying close to the customer and mapping the organisation’s strengths. 

Graduated from IIT Kanpur with a B.Tech in Civil Engineering and minor degree in Industrial and Management Engineering.

Strengths: Problem Solver, Customer Empathy, Data Driven and Product Development.

Technologies: Python, R, SQL, Hive, C, Plotly, Dash, etc.

PeopleCues
PeopleCues
735 followers
735 followers
6-week review cycles were the norm. Until now.

At Angel One, performance reviews that once took 4–6 weeks now wrap up in just 2–4, and that shift means everything. Huge thanks to Angel One team for the kind words, and for recognizing what we truly care about:
📈 “You’ve moved the needle on the metrics that matter in a performance review.” –
🤖 “The AI-led SBI feedback engine has completely changed the quality of feedback.” –

It’s a reminder that meaningful change at work doesn’t need to be loud, just well-designed.
If a better review experience helps employees feel heard and managers make sharper decisions, we’re doing our job right.

What’s one underrated shift that’s made a big difference in your org? Comment below.

Visit my website
1mo • 
 1 month ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
A year after Binny Bansal sold his $1bn stake in Flipkart in 2018, he began laying the foundations for his next venture: a “McKinsey for Startups” ⤵️

At an event in Bangalore last year, Binny explained his motivations for setting up xto10x → “Instead of making a thousand mistakes, if we can help other startups make a hundred or even a few hundred, that would be worth it.” → succinct yet powerful.

Binny partnered with Saikiran who worked at Flipkart and was a Senior Partner @ McKinsey for 15 years prior; Sai is a co-founder of the firm along with Neeraj Aggarwal (ex VP at Flipkart)

3 years after founding, the firm was profitable. And, on 9th Feb ‘22, Binny topped the company up with $25M in funding (from his own pocket). We don’t have latest data on company performance, since it is SG domiciled, but FY23 was ~$14M in revenue & profitable.

xto10x combines the traditional ‘McKinsey model’ i.e. consulting (70% of revenue) with a ‘builders approach’ i.e. product / software led engagements (30% of revenue)

“PeopleCues” is their software platform, priced at ~$8 per seat per month, which comprises

(a) OKR management
(b) Performance management
(c) Culture & Employee NPS (eNPS)

In addition to the software, they offer consulting services like:
(1) Coaching → Pre-IPO coaching & founder coaching
(2) Strategy → Org Design, Leadership hiring etc
(3) Hands-on → Growth engine design & implementation

💡Very similar to McKinsey & its MBB peers, xto10x focuses on having small teams working deeply with large clients (200+ names including CRED, Groww, Razorpay, Meesho etc). Btw, many people don’t know that McKinsey also has a LOT of software which it sells to clients (topic for another post) - so the two firms are quite similar!

What makes xto10x unique is that alongside consulting fees, it sometimes take an equity stake in companies it works with → per TRACXN, it has equity in ~35 companies (mostly at the Series B stage). HENCE, it has real skin in the game 💪

➡️The goal ofis clear from the name itself → to help founders on the X to 10X journey. As their website says: “Scaling is hard. We make it easier.” This is an interesting n::1 business!

…more

Adoro is a fashion-focused social-network for women to discover & shop products and trends that are liked, curated, updated real-time from across the web.

The project involved "Optimization of personalized user recommendation engine". Recommendation engine has been created which incorporates the user's past behavior (items previously purchased or selected and score given to those items) as well as decision made by other users. Suggested new attributes which increases the accuracy of recommendation engine.
